hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Exhaustion Fade in High Volatility
hypothesis_content.statement: In a STRESS or high-volatility BEAR regime, an extreme 4-hour price move (>8%) on declining volume (volume < 80% of prior 4-hour candle) represents momentum exhaustion and will revert significantly within the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In panicked, high-volatility environments, large moves on thin volume are often driven by illiquid order book sweeps or forced liquidations, not sustainable trend initiation, creating a high-probability mean reversion setup.
entry_conditions: Regime is STRESS or BEAR with 20-day realized volatility > 80% annualized.
A 4-hour candle records an absolute return > 8%.
The volume of that candle is < 80% of the volume of the preceding 4-hour candle.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the extreme 4-hour candle's range.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves a further 3% in the direction of the initial extreme move.
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit at the close of the 3rd 4-hour candle after entry (12 hours).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median 12-hour forward return after such a signal is positive (i.e., the momentum continues instead of reversing).
